intro: Aspidogyne boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian aspidogyne, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Aspidogyne boliviensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
